replies.msg:
è‘¡è„ç‰™å ±ç´™ä¾†ï¼Œæ¢å‹è‘¡è„ç‰™äºº å¥½ä¼¼
æ“šèåŒç·Šç¾…é¦¬çˆ­ï¼Œè‚¯ä¿¾3m release clauseå°±ææ‚

Roman Abramovich has felt the need of having a name at the ‘international level’ to take care of football, especially for a period when the Blues could be banned from making signings.

Who is Luis Campos?

Campos is a Portuguese technical director at Lille who has previously worked at AS Monaco and Real Madrid when Jose Mourinho was in charge of the Bernabeu side.

When at Monaco he based the club's transfer model on the model that Porto had, setting up high levels of software to search and track players that would fit with what the side were looking for.

"My position is right-back, but if I have to play another position, I am not fazed by it. I will offer to play in any position. As a right-back, a big part of my game is crossing, and I like getting forward. I am also half decent at defending.
